title: Country Summer by Leonie Adams
body: Now the rich cherry, whose sleek wood, And top with silver petals traced Like a strict box its gems encased, Has spilt from out that cunning lid, All in an innocent green round, Those melting rubies which it hid; With moss ripe-strawberry-encrusted, So birds get half, and minds lapse merry To taste that deep-red, larkâ€™s-bite berry, And blackcap bloom is yellow-dusted.
